content.rendered:
What is a Data Analyst?

Data Analysts collect and compile data to produce useful insights for a given project, client, or organization. By identifying trends and drawing conclusions from those trends, data analysts are able to provide quantitative and qualitative reasoning to support or oppose a business decision.

Where does a Data Analyst work?

  • Investment banks
  • Healthcare services
  • Marketing companies

How much does a Data Analyst make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Data Analyst is $59,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Data Analysts?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Computer science majors
  • Software engineering majors
  • General engineering majors
Search Data Analyst jobs on Handshake

Data Analyst skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Data Analyst succeed in their work:

  • Strong analytical skills
  • Teamwork and collaboration
  • Knowledge of relevant computer languages

What are some common questions about Data Analysts?

Q: How do I get a job in data analysis?A: Check out tips and tricks for all things data science related here!

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, related questions, and common path after college to becoming a Data Analyst.
